node.title: GOHAM!
node.subtitle: Reestablish the Columbia community during COVID-19 through exercise

description.description: GOHAM! was expanded on top of WorkOut! but with more emphasis on spontaneous human interaction through gamification. The app also considers many challenges faced by WorkOut! such as content curation and how individual users would use the app. Read more about the design process in the blog post.

node.title: ShibaMatch
node.subtitle: Choose a restaurant for a group in a breeze

description.description: ShibaMatch helps users make decisions on which restaurant to go for gatherings. Sometimes a group cannot decide upon a restaurant to go to, which causes unnecessary time to ping-pong ideas. They also have to search through the web to check for good places that suit the group's preferences, which takes more time. On ShibaMatch each individual user in the group can independently like or displike on restaurant cards and the app will automatically figure out the best restaurant for the group.

node.title: WorkOut!
node.subtitle: Work out with people living in small spaces during the pandemic

description.description: Exercising app for college students living in a small space during the COVID-19 pandemic. The app helps motivate and keep students in a routine to exercise in a limited space. The design tackles on the problem of motivating the users through the use of human interaction and gamification.

node.title: Crimes Database
node.subtitle: Database of crimes for specific locations in the U.S.; Tackling issues on police brutality

description.description: As newcomers to a city, we never know nor have connections who can tell us which part of the city is dangerous. The app centralizes crime data in the U.S. and looks for crimes related to specific locations (states) within the U.S. to identify dangerous locations that newcomers should avoid. Another aspect tackled is the issue on police brutality. We showed the record of the police officer with their associated charges, hoping to have a positive impact on the officersâ€™ actions (such as them having a second thought before doing the wrong) since they will be publicly organized and displayed.

My own ICMP Traceroute and ICMP Ping program written in Python using raw sockets, ICMP request, and reply messages. Traceroute will print out a list of IP addresses of all routers in the path from source to destination and the RTT.
Web/Mobile app to collect video ideas from peers. Implemented upvote and comment functionality to get an idea of what sort of videos people like and create videos with highest demand.

Proxy server written in Python using the Socket API.
The proxy will receive a GET request and communicate with the server. The proxy is able to receive files from the server, cache it, and forward it to the client. It is able to handle 404 and 301 errors.

Online platform for taching language through various TV shows and their subtitles. Users are able to learn important vocabulary words and phrases chosen with NLP for each episode before watching the episode. Each word and phrase has an audio associated so that users can learn the correct pronunciation. There is also a quiz component where you can test your understanding before watching the show. I worked on the backend with Node and Express.

Website for the Japanese Student Association displaying general information, upcoming events, and how to get involved. Functionality of adding board members to website. Developed with Python with flask and PostgreSQL

Synchronous transcribing for short meetings (<5 min)  and asynchronous transcribing for longer meetings. Analyzes keywords that appeared during the meeting and ranks them by mentioned more than 10 times, 30 times, and random suggestions using NLP. Utilized the various Google Cloud APIs.

Forecasted lab earthquakes by denoising acoustic data and applying FFT to divide into components with different frequencies. Utilized feature extraction from short term average, long term average, k-Nearest neighbors, mean, standard deviation, max, min, quantile, trend, peak-to-peak, moments, and geometric and harmonic series. Used LightGBM for the machine learning model.

Predicted the stock market movement for the next week for S&P500 stocks using LSTM for the machine learning model. Cleaned data and focused on adjusted open, adjusted high, adjusted low, adjusted close, and moving average values for training.

node.title: HELP
node.subtitle: Android Housing Application: Yelp but for housing

description.description: Crowdsourced landlord and apartment rating application. Users will be able to rate landlords and apartments, creating a knowledge base accessible to the whole world. We aimed to eliminate the unpleasant surprises such as bad landlords or low maintance housing through other user's reviews.

node.title: Manhunt
node.subtitle: Best Use of Database Award at Brandeis Codestellation 2016

description.description: Web Application for playing Manhunt, a variation of game of tag. The goal of this game is to try to avoid getting tagged by an 'it'. I implemented the traking of different user's geolocations.
